name: Andy Anarch Suite
HB Fast Advance
Aneurysm Annihilation
description: ALL THE DAIN BRAMAGE.

name: Facade
Triple Play Silhouette
description:
A faster version of the "Notorious Daily Quester" deck. Link in the "Derived" list.

The major changes are geared toward increasing the credits the deck makes while freeing up room for the Datasuckers that naturally fit in a deck that aggressively runs.

The goal of the deck is to constantly apply pressure to R&D and HQ, and grabbing agendas with Quest Completed when the time is right--hence the desire to keep a moderate amount of credits on hand at all times.

I removed Notoriety, as much as it pained me. For the one or two agenda points it might score, I'd rather have my Quality Times be more flexible Diesels, especially for the early game. Likewise, Desperado rewards early-game running more than Doppleganger, and keeps helping with the credit flow.

This deck's all theorycrafting at this point, but any and all comments and suggestions are welcome.

name: A-Noise-Ing
description: Turbo mill using Mass Install with program econ up the wazoo. Can't wait for Cache!!!

name: Silhouette 1.4
description: 1.4 -some parasites, + scrubber and quest completed 1.5 +1 Tri maf contract, -1 security testing, -1gun, +1 plascrete

name: House of Knives 1.0
House of Knives 1.1
Mind Maggots
description: Kate's got an earworm for the megacorps...

name: Bionic Commando
description: Kate's swinging thru megacorps with her grappling gun!

name: Mind Bomb
description: Kate is dropping Overmind bombs on the megacorps!

name: Professor X
Jinteki Fast Advance MK. 2
description: This is a more effective version than the last that I created. You definitely don't care about bad pub. You just want to push out those agendas or attempt to kill with a Mushin No Shin + Project Junebug.

name: I, for one, welcome our new Chaos Theory Overmind!
description: Can a deck with Overmind as the only breaker work?

name: CT Overmind
description:
Im planning to take this to a local tournament, just for the fun of it :)

Havent playtested yet, but the idea is pretty simple. Have much unused MU + Hardware recursion and walk through the ice with Overmind. Added Dagger for Protection against Swordsman

name: Operation Overmind 2.0
description: now with more money

name: HMT v2.0
Classy Kate v2
Kit-a-saurus
description: Parasite Recursion. Yog.0 + Dino for added strength and minty breath.

name: Shi Kyu Harmony v1.4
description:
Built to take advantage of a couple of synergies. Mental Health Clinic + sweeps week. And harmony medtechs ability to field just 6 3 pointers in a 44 card deck along with a full 3 copies of shi-kyu. Changes: added power shutdown and swapped trap suite around. need to put pressure on the runner early-mid game.

More changes: dropped the sweeps week package as it seemed counter-intuitive with the shi-kyus. Was often making it too expensive to let me force them to take a -1 pointer. Feel like the deck needs to behave quite aggressively, it needs to score a 3 pointer early before the runner is settled, then you can force them into bad plays.

name: Deus ex cyphera
description: My idea for a cyber cypher deck. really looking for feedback

name: Lucky Oversucker (Overdeck)
Big Bad Walls
description:
Game plan: out of hand scoring, no remotes except for Jackson. If opportunity presents itself (after crippling runner's econ with Closed Accounts) could maybe go for a Tollbooth/Caprice/Agenda remote.

Being confined to the central servers makes us rely only on the operation economy, which is fine with mostly pretty cheap Ice and Jackson is there to recycle the operations (but primarily TOL).

For RnD & HQ: Caprice on one of those, big ice wall on the other.

Not sure Cerebral Cast belongs here but had some strange luck running into Reina or other control decks all the time while testing Tennin, so decided to try it out bringing some Closed Accounts along which hopefully prevent the runner from running for another turn or two.

name: NBN Punitive Surprise
description:
Given the state of the meta, when your opponent sees TWIY, they'll expect a fast advance deck. I've tried to mimic the usual fast advance ICE to support that illusion.

The fun part is, this deck's appearance of fast advance is merely meant to put the runner's guard down. If their guard is down, they won't install Plascretes, and if they steal one of your 3-pointers, it's Punitive time.

Realistically, this deck can only win once per opponent, so this is mostly a joke. Let me know if it works on anyone!

name: No-Siphon CT Rush v0.1
description:
First, thanks to Jamieson/Fjord for the archetype.

Since I've settled on CT as my go-to runner, it's been my goal to make a tournament-viable rush deck that doesn't rely on Account Siphon spam. Some of these card choices are my usual favorite includes. The initial draft of this deck was inspired by Jamieson's "In a Red Dress and Alone". It was pretty messy, and doesn't much resemble this one anymore.

The second draft was heavily, heavily tweaked to look more like Fjord's "Dinomite", minus the Account Siphon recursion. I appreciate that Fjord's deck gave up on the Motivation-Eureka combo, which often failed to fire for me. I also like the idea to throw away a dedicated sentry breaker and just go full Femme-o-Saurus. That, and Fjord's choice of Events is much tighter, so I pretty much ripped those off completely.

I like deep digs, so I included more Interfaces. The choice to include the Unregistered S&W '35 comes from the fact that Chaos Theory with a gun is probably the funniest card combination in Netrunner. That, and at the moment (H&P has just come out) I'm concerned not only with Jacksons, but Caprices and Chairman Hiros.

This deck draws cards furiously and installs a suite of Opus-Femme-Torch-Morning Star very quickly. It plays "vanilla Netrunner" at high speed. No weird tricks. Just breakers and an Opus, with the potential for deep digs.

Let me know your thoughts. It's a work in progress, and feedback is appreciated. I really want to move this deck in a unique direction over time. Here are some ideas that I've been playing with:

*Finding room for 1x Deus Ex (depending how popular Jinteki becomes)

*Finding room for a second Levy (maybe)

*Eliminating R&D interfaces. (I like the surprise include of HQ interface a little better in Shaper)

*Finding the room and influence for Sneakdoor. (always a great surprise to pull a "Test Run-click-click-click" with Sneakdoor)

*Finding room for an Escher (probably in place of the Stimhack).

*Personal Touch is another holdover from Jamieson's deck that I might drop. I'm not sure how to deal with gigantic barriers without it, but it does tend to just sit in my hand.

name: HB Pay to Play
I'd Like to Teach the World to Sing
description:
I'm already getting tired of playing and playing against the current round of Jintiki death by 1000 cuts decks so I thought I'd make something different for once.

This deck isn't so much fast advance as steady advance, that said if your playing a mid-game runner then you should be able to score out six points in a few turns.

name: Deus ex cyphera 2.0  (now with Plascretes)
Blue True Control deck.
description:
The plan of this deck is essentially to give the corp no way to protect itself. It plays in two phases.

Nutshell: It starts with an early agenda steal, and a logos install. If some ice get rezzed, fine, use e-shutdown and crescentus with overmind to derez the ice in preparation for phase 2. Once you have an agenda, build up money and dig for same old thing, blackmail, and frame job. If the corp scores, they've just given you frame job with logos. Begin the blackmail runs.

Phase 1: Phase 1 is the desperate attempts to get an agenda. Inside job HQ and RD to try to luck out. Do this at all costs, if you must, use an overmind to get in. If you get enough money to drop an interface, then do it, increase your chances of a score. Once you've scored your agenda and installed logos you're prepared for Phase 2. Phase 1 ends when you've frame job'ed the corp per above.

Phase2: The corp either removes the bad pub, or can't protect itself. So you begin building mutli access and commence R&D and HQ locking. The source didn't make the cut, so FA is a threat. Overmind protects for when you must run the remotes. Luckily there is room for E3 to help save OM counters. Iain's ability keeps you flush with credits working with Kati to power the OM. Use crescentus to keep ice derezzed. HQI and RDI allow you to sweep HQ and R&D with impunity with blackmail runs. You can use feint and inside job to shut down any ice that gets rezzed. This counters the only known blackmail counters, (OAI and BER, also amazon industrial). Planned assault and same old thing mean you have quick access to blackmail. Levy keeps the pain-train trolling.

Basically it removes ice like a blue/control deck removes creatures in magic.

name: Tainted Fun Bridge
Iain Connections v 1.1
description: awe

name: Activist Anarchist
description: Fall Guy makes all those resources so good. This deck tries hard to keep the corp broke by running frequently or by a full set of resources that are a chore to be trashed. A single turn of any of these resources can be fatal.

name: Iain Connections v 2.0
description: My more account siphon and central-focused version of Iain, with Inside Jobs to snipe remotes.

name: ALL I KNOW HOW TO DO IS MAKE EVENT DECKS NOW I GUESS
On The Lam
description:
Seems everyone has got an Express deck at this point. Mine is probably no different and definitely nothing special. Filled to the brim with Run Events, obviously, though I also used the new central only criminal icebreakers and things like the interfaces and Legwork and Maker's Eye to hammer R&D and HQ, with Crypsis to clean up outside in remotes if need be.

Tell me what you think!

name: NBN Burns
Oversucker
NEXT Zoo
Masanori and Tenma: Bros for Life v1.1
description:
Short version: Masanori gives Tenma all the run events. Never stop running.

Long version: my take on the basic Kenma "All the Rune Events" deck. Planned assault allows you to get the most out of one-ofs you bring in for minimal influence, so I threw the kitchen sink in there. Between Legwork, Maker's Eye, Indexing, and Running Interferance, you should have no problem finding/accessing cards. 1x Blackmail is often a dead draw, but hilariously worth it when it works.

Desperado, Bank Job, Kati and AS should keep you fine on money.

Breaker set is pretty self explanatory.

I originally ran Wyldside instead of Masanori, but I wanted the influence for run events and breakers. If you've got an idea for a solid Wyldside-Kenma deck, let me know.

name: Scorch Combo Denkus for a Scorch Combo Dingus
description:
nothin' special, just playing around with the power shutdown -> accelerated scorch combo because why not.

just to explain the combo in case you ain't know how it works:

  1. get accelerated diagnostics and power shutdown in your hand + jackson howard in your hand or ideally on the board. at least two scorches must be in R&D or archives (not in hand).

  2. get at least 11 credits - ideally more if you have to SEA source them to tag them.

  3. get the runner tagged, either with SEA source, Draco or Data Raven.

  4. bait the runner into a run once you have the combo pieces in hand. give them a free agenda if necessary, it ain't matter, you're about to burn their house down anyways.

  5. your turn begins. click one, SEA source if necessary, or if they're already tagged go ahead and Power Shutdown your entire R&D into archives. then, use Jackson's ability to shuffle your three scorches back into R&D for a free action. finally, Accelerated Diagnostics, conveniently turning over three scorches to hit them for 12 meat damage all at once.

GAME OVER NERDS

name: Dame Kit, the Speedy
description:
The biggest issue with Paintbrush is unrezzed ICE. Knight solves that issue handily. This deck aims to be a fast and aggressive one, with an eventual R&D lock.

Snitch is a test. I feel like it might be a good way to not waste Kit's Ability. It may get swapped to a Nerve Agent.

name: CT Overmind
description:
Im planning to take this to a local tournament, just for the fun of it :)

Havent playtested yet, but the idea is pretty simple. Have much unused MU + Hardware recursion and walk through the ice with Overmind. Added Sharpshooter for Protection against Swordsman

name: Now For The Main Event
description:
I have always been a huge fan of Events in this game which is why I primarily play Criminals.

So naturally I jumped on an event heavy deck.

I play tested this with some friends and it fits my aggressive play style of just running a lot and having an answer for things.

I did not want to go the notiriety route, but that is another option.

If my meta starts to develop a lot of Caprice Nisies then I will some how squeeze a couple of US&W 35s into this deck.

Let me know what you think.

name: PSI madness v2
description:
Primary goal is to win on points behind Ash and Caprice with flatline being a secondary win condition.

This deck wants to build a single remote with nasty upgrades and start scoring. Every time they take brain damage from Cerebral Cast it's a victory for you. If they take the tag, close their accounts and prepare to score.

Also with this agenda setup it is rather safe to Celeb Gift your entire hand most of the time. Snowflake is great, people actually usually break it which is an amazing deal - you get a 3str barrier for a single credit!

Shocks fend off Datasuckers and milling decks, with Jacksons to further assist. If you're ballsy, hide Future Perfect in the archives behind Shocks!, finish them up with Punitive :).

name: Average Height Average Build
Nil Mortifi Sine Lucre
I need 6, you need 7.  (JTHM.3.0)
description:
Just a couple of quick changes from the last version:

-1 Jackson -1 Ice Wall -1 Guard +1 GRNDL Refinery +1 Shi.Kyū +1 Susanoo-No-Mikoto

Squeezed in a little more money, upgraded one Sentry because of the money, and fit in the third Shi.Kyū.

name: A Thousand Pricks
description:
I play tested it a few games and liked it a lot.

I took out the Houksai Grids to add a third Tori Hanzo and a Chairman Hiro. I have liked this change so far.

I swapped the celebrity gifts for Hedge Funds. I do not always want to show my hand with this deck.

My most recent changes have been on the ice. I have not play tested the new ice, but it may have only made the deck better. We will see.

Thanks djackman for the awesome deck idea.

name: Whizzard Keyscroll
description:
Logos is so good in Anarch. It solves many problems with regards to lack of tutors necessary to setup the perfect rig. It has great synergy with Queen's gambit, since it mitigates wrong guesses.

Personal workshop and Aesop are also a lot more affordable now, since you only need to splash 1 copy of each in your deck. This means Wyldside is once again viable, and PW still works wonders with Anarch programs.

The final card choice is 3x Sharpshooter. These are not always useful, but in certain matchups, they really help a lot. Whizzard typically has programs installed like Djinn or Datasucker very early on with no breakers installed, so not being able to run because you're scared of Destroyers suck. Sharpshooter solves that problem. Plus, ices like Archer and Ichi 2.0 are really annoying to break with Mimic anyway. You can always Aesop if you need to.

The cyberfeeders are flexible and can be swapped with other options, such as Daily Casts. I think they do a decent job of making corroder and mimic breaks cheap, protects against power shutdown, and can be Aesop'd for money in emergencies.

The Ice Carver is there as backup. The lack of Grimoire can hurt a bit for the Datasuckers and Parasites, that's where Ice Carver steps in.

Memory can be an issue since you lose 1 MU over Grimoire with Logos. The ideal setup should have Djinn hosting Keyhole and a Datasucker, with 3 breakers out. Personal workshop helps greatly here to make sure you install your programs in the right order. You can always Aesop datasuckers and install new ones on top of Djinn if necessary.

Finally, the choice of identity is flexible. I chose Whizzard because trashing key assets is really important to slow the game down and give you time to setup your rig. Noise's ability is OK, but this deck doesn't run that many viruses. Reina Roja is decent, but you might not run every turn, especially with Wyldside installed, so you can't use the ability that effectively.

name: RP Slow Advance
The Stirling Connection (v1.2)
description:
Overall, I felt this deck play more like a Shaper as it requires the player to take time to build his or her rig with "Connection" resources. It may not have the aggressiveness seen in most of the Criminal identity or even with Kate Datasucker and Chaos Theory Event build such as Chaos Thievery introduced by PeekaySK.

The key to this deck is to put down as many Connection Resources (there are total of 13 Connection Resources that can be played, minus one additional copy of Kati Jones since it is unique) and then later play Calling in Favors to gain big money.

I don't think this deck is of tournament material especially (if the players need to allow the Corp to score agenda first before Stirling's ability get to activate) but I believe it is solid enough for casual play.

As with most Runner decks that focus more on building the rig first, The Stirling Connection will have problem dealing with Fast Advance corp decks especially from NBN with its Astrochain. I personally think when playing against Fast Advance deck is to just forget about Stirling's power can prevent the corp from scoring first.

Data Dealer I can see the potential of Data Dealer to be useful in Stirling deck if he wants to have a lower agenda score than the Corp but would probably suggest to only use it on the 1 pointer agenda.

Even if it is not used, it can help provide an additional credit for Calling in Favour. Furthermore, Data Dealer does not require any credit to install.

Tri-Maf Contact I am apprehensive of having more than one copy of this card. One reason, you can only use it once per turn. Second reason, with more than 1 copy, the other will most probably become "dead" card. Third reason, I don't like idea of having to thrash Tri-Maf from my grip or to be snipe by the Corp as a result of some damage taken.

Fall Guy The use of Fall is mostly to protect Professional Contact and also Kati Jones from being thrashed. I don't think I would likely to thrash it to gain 2 credit.

Compromised Employee and Forged Activation I think Forged Activation combo well with Compromise Employee. I can instead of running forced the Corp to rez its Ice and then gain credit from Compromised Employee.

No Emergency Shutdown I am still unsure about this. It can be argued that this may synergise well with Compromised Employee by forcing the Corp to derez its Ice after running the HQ and then rez it again to activate the credit gain ability of Compromised Employee. At this moment, my apprehension of not putting them in is due to the card limit. Will have to think later what card I can take out to put Emergency Shutdown in to see how it plays out.

Sneakdoor Beta I have been mulling the limitations of this deck without Sneakdoor Beta. Without it, this deck cannot put pressure on three of the Corp's central server. Also, it may act as a surprise to the Corp player because they may often think that Sneakdoor Beta is mostly played by Gabe. Also, the Corp is less likely to defend the Archive especially they don't see Datasucker in play.

Decoy instead of Plascrete I opt to put in Decoy as an answer to Scorched Earth threat instead of using Plascrete Carapace in order to have more connection card in play.

No Console I am undecided whether to put a console in but if I do, I would most probably have 1 Desperado and not multiple copy. I need room for my Dyson Mem Chip so it can activate Underworld Contact.

I don't really like Logos, the new Criminal console from Honor and Profit. If Logos came out late, the Corp will already score most of the agenda for the Runner to reap any benefit from Logos. However, a friend of mine argued that to get Logos out early, put in 3 copy. True, but in comparison to Desperado, Logos is much more expensive and, in my personal opinion, don't offer much utility value.

E3 Feedback I put in this card is just to surprise the HB player. Currently many of them do not expect Runner to pack this in (especially when my friend have Heimdal 1.0, Heimdal 2.0, and Januse as their Ice). But if I need to take out a card to cut down to 45, I would probably remove E3.

I hope you all like this deck and will welcome any comment that come with it. Thanks.

name: 1000 cuts
description: the whole point of this is let them have agendas and just keep hitting them mushin the overwriter or junebug if they dont run them then its trick fuel for philotic

name: noisy mill 1.0
To The Heap!
Cryptic
Cryptic
HB Kicks Your Door Down v3
description:
In the recent changes to this deck, I've dropped the Blue Levels in favour of Archived Memories. I've often found myself with more money than I know what to do with and the Archived Memories will provide some versatility in this slot - they can be used to retrieve Ash, make Punitive Counterstrikes easier, or just get some economy back if there's nothing else to do.

I've also changed Caduceus and 2 Walls of Static into 2 Wraparounds and an Enigma as well as changing some ICE density to make sure there is enough early game protection. In a couple of games recently I've found myself 6-0 down (!) in the early game. I did manage to pull out the win each time, but increasing the likelihood that I'll survive to the lategame and deploy the big guys can only be a good thing. I would like to fit some Ichi 2.0s in, possibly for Enigma, but that may reduce my ETR a little too much.

Ash and NAPD Contract continues to be incredible, particularly in a big server - it is VERY easy to push the trace to a level where they can't steal the Contract if they beat it, and hopefully the Archived Memories will help them repeat their usefulness.

name: A-Noise-Ing 1.2
description:
Turbo mill using Mass Install with program econ up the wazoo. Can't wait for Cache!!! Played the crap out of this today. There is something to this, but it is lacking the tools in total. Pretty dang fun.

It is a basic durdle deck that just churns through cheap viruses. The econ in this is quite strong. Djinn for Cache, take off the counters, sac to Aesop's is very good. Basic Wyldside/Aesop's engine, utilizing Mass Install to leverage action loss--with Deja Vu as reloading means.

Ultimately, the deck wants to mill the crap out of the corp and try and make big runs. The single Femme is there for corps that shallowly defend their Archives. In truth, I think this deck could play a single Crypsis, as you can facecheck and play the Parasite/Sucker game, where possible.

Something to this deck, though I made it moreso for a friend who just likes to play more of a passive game. Cache will be massive for Noise in general. Tried a few iterations of this all day today and made edits as we went. I would gladly drop:

Femme Scheherazade Daily Casts 1 Crypsis--you can find it with Medium

At a glance, Origami should be good if it increases handsize by 2. Needs. More. Cheap. Viruses!!!

name: Teaching Dinos to Love
description:
Pretty standard CT tutoring deck.

R&D Interface can be subbed for Maker's Eye, depending on now you like to play.

Sneakdoor beta works nicely mid-to-end game when they're not expecting it and used all their good ICE on other servers. Stimhack is also a fun surprise when you're not expected you to get through.

name: Braintraps
description:
No one wants to run at something you've installed behind existing ICE as install-advance-advance (especially if you've let them see an Overwriter already!). So do it and keep consistent.

Corporate Trouble Shooter - save for when you think you can out bid the runner and use it on something like Janus or Ichi.

Psychic Field is fun to just leave there and wait to see if curiosity overcomes the runner.
